response_type: Comprehensive List of Export Control Classification Numbers (ECCNs) and Categories

preliminary_notes.description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) may also control exports of items subject to the EAR and on the Commerce Control List (CCL). Exporters should consult relevant FDA and DEA regulations and should not rely solely on the EAR for information about other agency export control requirements. Refer to Supplement No. 3 to part 730 for more information.
Items subject to the EAR that are not elsewhere specified in the CCL Category or in any other category in the CCL are designated by the number EAR99.

ccl_categories.title: Nuclear Materials and Related Items, Firearms, and Miscellaneous Military/Law Enforcement Items (Implied Category 0 based on ECCNs)

items.description: Power generating or propulsion equipment "specially designed" for use with space, marine or mobile "nuclear reactors" ("subject to the ITAR")
Firearms (except 0A502, 0A506, 0A507, and 0A508) and related commodities

Shotguns; shotguns "parts" and "components," consisting of complete trigger mechanisms; magazines and magazine extension tubes; "complete breech mechanisms;" except semi-automatic shotguns controlled under ECCN 0A508, certain "parts," etc. controlled under 0A509, and certain animal/signal arms

items.note_general: Technical Notes (1-7) provide detailed criteria for counting axes, "contouring control," axis nomenclature (ISO 841:2001), "tilting spindle," and determining 'Stated "unidirectional positioning repeatability"' for machine tools, including measurement uncertainty and test procedures (ISO 230-2:2014).
